about: I'm a person, who is not afraid of challenges. After finishing Bachelor Degree, I decided to change departments of studies completely to broaden my horizons, but still studied in English language. Also, I decided to seek better career opportunities and took on promotion in Wrocław and at the same time I was finishing studies in Szczecin. During my maternity leave I decided to start learning about programming. Using all available sources like books, videos, blogs and free courses I started learning JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Next I introduced React. Recently, I started to use Github and Git. The next challenge on my list is to start learning TypeScript.
hobbies: reading books, especially mystery, thriller, memoir, biography, guide and non-fictions ones
watching Football, I'm a Manchester United fan
playing video games, especially sandbox ones

studies.department: Faculty of Economics, Finance and Management

work.place: Marino Shopping Mall, Wrocław (06.2018 - 08.2020, including Maternity Leave: 08.2019-08.2020)
jobDescription: Ability to work in dynamic work environment, adapt to change and flexibility towards making plans and setting priorities
Ability to work and making decisions under pressure
Recruitment, staff trainings, writing performance review and development recommendations
Sales force, team and time management
Team supervision and providing feedback
Active participation in maximizing selling and preventing loss.
Analyzing and follow up on Sales and Profit reports on regular basis
Management of administration and staff regulations issues, along with preparing work schedule or managing leaves of absence.
Management and onboarding of the staff
Team management
Customer services that contributes to the sales and profit goals
Handling tasks related to accounting and cash flow
Handling the cash office administration along with in-store stock, banking, work accordance with applicable law and privacy policy in the company following safety and security requirements
Direct customer service
Ensuring efficient stock replenishment
Unloading and unpacking merchandise
Visual merchandising acording to company's standards
Customer service
Cash register operating
Team management
Ensuring the flow of products between the sales floor and warehouse
The arrangement of work stations
Team work and effective communication with other members of the team
Controlling of the stock level of products
Work according to the standards of the company.
